title: 107_s2458
content: Establishment of initiatives for predominantly Muslim countries. The Congress finds that negative opinions of the United States in predominantly Muslim countries are distorted by misinformation and propaganda, prejudicing US interests. To improve this image, programs promoting American society and values will be established by the Secretary of State. The Department of State will establish programs with predominantly Muslim countries for educational and cultural exchange, including a journalism program for foreign journalists and students, and a library program to improve literacy and support public education. The goal is to promote American values and democracy. The Secretary of State will establish programs to promote American values and democracy, including English language teaching grants, sister city partnerships, and a youth ambassador program for international students visiting the United States. The Secretary of State will establish programs to promote American values and democracy, including English language teaching grants, sister city partnerships, and a youth ambassador program for international students visiting the United States. Additionally, the Secretary shall seek to increase awards under the Fulbright exchange program for individuals from the United States to study, teach, conduct research, or pursue scholarship in predominantly Muslim countries, with a focus on American studies. The Secretary aims to increase Hubert H. Humphrey Fellowships for candidates from predominantly Muslim countries. Programs will be conducted under relevant acts. The Secretary will establish a database of American and foreign alumni of exchange programs to promote networking and communication. Additionally, a report will be made on the inclusion of freedom and democracy advocates in educational and cultural exchange programs. The Secretary of State must report to Congress within 90 days on the implementation of a specific section of the Human Rights, Refugee, and Other Foreign Relations Provisions Act. The report will detail the number of grants for exchange programs, measures taken to include supporters of freedom and democracy, and evaluate the openness of U.S. exchange programs to these supporters in certain countries. Additionally, the Act clarifies that it does not authorize visas for inadmissible aliens and authorizes appropriations for its implementation. Authorization of $35,000,000 for the Department of State for fiscal years 2003 and 2004. Definition of "Secretary" as the Secretary of State.
